title: Game Center CX - Near Perfect Complete English Collection
description:
GAME CENTER CX: NEAR PERFECT COMPLETE ENGLISH COLLECTION
December 5th, 2013 Edition

===

Hello!


This torrent comprises >what I believe< to be the most current 

and complete collection of Game Center CX videos released on the 

internet by English fan subbing groups as of December 5th, 2013.

I decided to put this collection together to demonstrate my love 

for the series, and to help as many people as possible get in 

touch with GCCX without having to struggle to find the episodes. 

Currently, it can be a real pain to track down all the episodes 

in decent quality (it has taken me a year to gather all this 

material). I hope this collection sets a new standard in getting 

the show out to the people and the confusion of the past few 

years can be left behind!

---

What is Game Center CX (GCCX)?

GCCX is a live-action, unscripted video game show that revolves 

around the trials and tribulations of our host, middle-aged 

Japanese comedian Chief Arino, as he marathon plays through some 

of the most difficult and challenging video games on consoles 

ranging the NES, Super Nintendo, Playstation, and everything in-

between. Arino's goal is to simply beat the game challenge of the 

day and become a champion, or go home an abject failure... 

Oftentimes, he's a little bit of both!


However, GCCX isn't just a gaming show. It has a wide appeal and 

will entertain all, whether you're a hardcore gamer or the type 

of person that mispronounces Mario's name. Side-splitting humor, 

intense gaming, triumphant comebacks, memorable miracle moments 

and detailed peeks into the whole other world that is Japanese 

gaming are just a few of the highlights GCCX has to offer as 

Arino struggles through multiple games spanning many consoles and 

genres. Truly, this is a magnificent comedygamingplain ole' 

human show, and you now have hours of material to pore through 

waiting at your fingertips. 


To put it in the purest terms: GCCX is one of those TV shows that 

you need in your life. I guarantee you will come to love GCCX for 

probably the rest of your life. Yeah, it's THAT good.

---

WHAT'S IN THE TORRENT?:
All current English translated episodes of GCCX, seasons 1-17 in 

their best available quality, including all currently translated 

specials, live events, advertisements, Nintendo Channel episodes, 

extra Arino appearances on Japanese TV, and much more.


All of this is neatly organized and arranged for ease of viewing. 

In interest of presenting all available subbed material, there 

are some episodes that overlap content from other episodes where 

sub groups have gone above and beyond and translated episodes 

beyond previous subbed releases. I have named these episodes to 

lessen confusion as "Full Coverage."


I have also included an episode guide that was last current in 

August 2013. I used it as a guide for tracking down the truly 

obscure bits of Arino-nalia out there. I also followed the naming 

scheme for the specialslive events and other material presented 

there, as well, to avoid confusion. Hopefully my efforts are good 

enough!


It's safe to say not many people have a collection of GCCX this 

complete, but sharing this show and getting the word out is more 

important than claiming to be a master collector.

---

WHAT ISN'T IN THE TORRENT? (AND WHY...):
In the interests of promoting the series without detracting from 

its Retro Game Master US DVD sales, I have not included the 14 Hi-

Def English subbed episodes contained on said US DVD. 

For now, you'll have to endure the Kotaku dubbed releases. 

However, if you want to find the original Japanese audio 

episodes, and you like the show and want to support more high-

quality, official subbed episodes being released in the future, 

please look up the Retro Game Master DVD at Amazon 

and 

similar sellers. 


By buying this relatively cheap DVD boxset (buy it from 1st party 

sellers, not from used sellers!), not only will you help GCCX 

out, you'll show that we want more Game Center CX material 

officially translated and presented in Hi-Def quality. Also, 

you'll get a previously unsubbed episode: Shiren the Wanderer. 

It's a great episode and you're missing out if you don't have it! 

The DVD is the only place to see it while also helping out our 

favorite beleaguered gamer, Chief Arino!

---

That should be all. If I am missing something, please let me know 

in the comments and I'll update my release. I may periodically update this pack 

with new files if the demand is there.

---

Special thanks to: SomethingAwful for subbing most of the 

episodes and working hard to spread the word; TV-Nihon for their 

efforts; Last Continue GCCX for their subbing; Kotaku for 

bridging the gap between shores; To anyone who subbed anything 

Game Center CX, ever; MaskedTai for organizing and creating 

torrents of the main folders before I refined them, you saved me 

a ton of work; To anyone who downloads and enjoys the show; To 

those who buy the Retro Game Master DVD and support the show; 

Most importantly, to Kacho Arino and all of the Game Center CX 

staff. Thank you for all your years of hard work and good luck on 

your future endeavors!! 

Enjoy!
